nealrichardson commented on issue #6557: ARROW-6821: [C++][Parquet] Do not require Thrift compiler when building (but still require library)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6557#issuecomment-596004471
 
 
   Just checking on the R build that does a bundled static build and was also building m4, flex, and bison in order to build thrift, the run time is down from 12 minutes on master to 8 minutes here. That's probably the biggest speedup we'll see since it was doing the most extra work, but any other builds that are bundling thrift should also see some speedups.

nealrichardson commented on issue #6557: ARROW-6821: [C++][Parquet] Do not require Thrift compiler when building (but still require library)
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/6557#issuecomment-596711602
 
 
   Ok, I tested locally using older versions of thrift, and I found that the code checked in here (compiled with thrift 0.13, current release, October 2019) works with 0.12 (January 2019, the version we have pinned in versions.txt) and 0.11 (December 2017) but it does not with 0.10 (January 2017). [0.10 is the minimum we require currently](https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/6fa6c91/cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake#L1157).
   
   Our options include, in increasing order of effort/maintenance burden required: 
   
   1. Bump the minimum required thrift version from 0.10 to 0.11
   2. Try generating the code with an older thrift compiler (0.11 or 0.12) and see if that gives us compatibility to the present as well as 0.10.
   3. In parquet's cmake, if thrift version is detected as 0.10, (re)compile the thrift (i.e. do what we previously did every time, just conditional on thrift version). 
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

   I would say either option 2 or 1. Definitely not option 3.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: Building Thrift from source carries extra toolchain dependencies (bison and flex). If we check in the files produced by compiling parquet.thrift, then the EP can be simplified to only build the Thrift C++ library and not the compiler. This also results in a simpler build for third parties
fields.summary: [C++][Parquet] Do not require Thrift compiler when building (but still require library)

comments.body: Yes please. I'm happy to help with this, though I'd need a little direction for what to put where (and then presumably there's a {{THRIFT_CMAKE_ARGS}} to add or remove).
